Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Letetia R Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great if you don't want any luxury. It was four walls and a bed. The staff was friendly and it was about a mile from the center of Venice. It was right next to a great restaurant and beautiful scenery. If you just need somewhere to lay your head and shower this would be great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Some clerks are bad”
Reviews.Author: ì½”ë‚œ
Reviews.Content: It was eight years ago when we stayed here with my family. Great location and cheap rate. But, we checked out, a clerk claimed some towels are missing. He/She wanted us to show our luggages. It was a horrible experience. I never want to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “world's worst night receptionist!”
Reviews.Author: Londonfields
Reviews.Content: Our stay in the Villa Parco was ruined by the Bangladeshi madman they employ to run the night desk, who literally yelled at us at the top of his voice when we arrived, saying we'd kept him up too late. It was just past midnight! Big deal. When we asked to see the room, he just exploded again. Lots more screaming. No way! The hotel was full. We could pay for the room right now - or get out! Who the hell did we think we were, etc? When we asked to see the manager, saying we wanted to complain, he now started swearing, saying the manager could f*** off. Totally unbelievable. Had it not been late, we would have left. Instead we spent the rest of our stay timing our coming in and out to avoid him. I have never met anyone working in a hotel that crazy and appalling. We loved the Lido generally, so it was just a shame we ended up there. The staff in the day time were fine, however, so it wasn't all bad. But a hotel that employs a person like that clearly doesn't care.

Reviews.Title: “My worst hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Mikael K
Reviews.Content: Where they got their stars from is still a mystery to me. No tv, no internet, no AC, no service what so ever. Not even the shower door was usable.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: ssacamps1
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel we stayed out of 8 budget hotels in Italy and Greece. It was the second most expensive. The room was old and smelly. It did not have a working tv or air condition. We asked reception (when we could find them...very rarely ever at the front desk) about it and they showed no concern or willingness to come to the room and check it out and they never offered to move us when they clearly had plenty of rooms open. The room had cracks in the walls, wallpaper peeling off, and the bathroom sliding glass doors were off their hinges and one slide away from being completely broken. The bed was hard and uncomfortable. The room was a dump!!!! The porch was the nicest place of the hotel. Great air flow and comfy chairs to eat and drink. it was 3 blocks from the beach. Not as crowded as Venice which was nice. It is a 50 minute boat ride and 5 minute bus ride to get to downtown Venice. Please, do not stay at this hotel. It is not worth the money. The service is horrendous. It ruined our experience. We will never recommend this hotel to anyone and would hope that you do not give them business because it was not worth the money we spent in comparison to our other budget hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! It was a clean, spacious and a quiet hotel!”
Reviews.Author: EJtotone
Reviews.Content: Me and my mum booked our trip on BMI baby to stay 2 nights in Venice with flights and we wasn't expecting much because we only paid Â£240 each for hotel and flights. We were pleasently surprised. The hotel was great! We arrived on Lido and we didn't know where we were going, it was late at night and so we just asked a taxi driver how much to the hotel and it was 13 euro. We got in the taxi and the hotel was a 5 minute drive if that. It was literally just down the main road from the water bus station on Lido. From then on we walked from our hotel to that water bus. It was in a great location as it was opposite a gorgeous restaurant which we had a meal and a few drinks at. The hotel was clean. We had 4 single beds in our room and it was a huge room. The beds were excellent, it must have been the best nights sleep I've had in years! I have stopped in lot of hotels 5 star plus and really this hotel is great and we will be back as we loved everything about our venice trip and hotel villa parco! The main thing too was that the hotel was so quiet and I love that about hotels. I hate doors slamming and noise of a night! I sound old but I'm a 29 year old that just loves travelling and having a great time! Oh our television didnt work but we was never in longer than 1 hour getting ready to go back out again and there isnt any WIFI but then again we didn't question it as overall the whole of the 2 night break was fantastic! Venice is just beautiful, it has got to be the best place I've ever visited!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, nicely located, well accommodated, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Dionisia2011
Reviews.Content: Lido is a beautiful place, ideal for escaping the crowded, Venice, and live among local people, so this hotel was ideal for this, if you don't mind 50 min. in vaporeto and 10 min. by bus. It is quiet clean, peaceful, and in a safe area. Surely good value for money. Kind and helpful receptionist.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings about this place”
Reviews.Author: vasikp
Reviews.Content: This hotel is more one/two stars but definitely not three. The location is good and cheap price is a clear benefit. We happily lived with the rough bed, cracked walls, cold room at night and semi clean bathroom. But the inability to get a hot tea or coffee in this place (no facilities in the room) is a bit over a top.

Reviews.Title: “Cheapest hotel in Venice, no frills”
Reviews.Author: sm99uk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about a 10-15 minute walk down the Lido, not as far as we anticipated having looked at a map, and a very easy walk down the main road. There is also a bus (free if you've got a Vaporetto ticket other than a single) service which runs very frequently and takes 2 minutes (3rd stop having left the Vaporetto stop). The staff were very nice and helpful and the hotel was attractive from the outside and in the lobby. The room, however, was shabby (faded carpet, peeling walls) and a little on the small side, but with a big bathroom. The shower was a bit rubbish and the room staff seemed undecided on how many towels we should have each day! We only had one thin pillow each and my friend's was extremely lumpy. When we asked to change it, the staff were unsure if there were any more because the hotel was full but did eventually find her one. The website advertises an internet cable in every room and I didn't see any obvious sign of this. I had asked before going if there was free wifi and was told there was, however we could not access this in our room as the router was down in the basement and only reached as far as the 1st floor (we just sat in the lobby instead). There was breakfast available downstairs in the basement, but we only knew this by chance as there was no information about it in the rooms and we weren't told about it by staff. We went to a local 'bar' about 5 minutes away instead (Bar Bepi - very nice croissants!). All in all, you get what you pay for. I would recommend staying on the Lido, but would perhaps pick a nicer hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!!”
Reviews.Author: BlessedWife
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a superb value. I went to Venice for stage one of Giro d' Italia and expected to pay top dollar for lodging. To my surprise this room was only 80 euro a night. I was very skeptical but took the chance as I was here for the race and the location was perfect. I had a nice large room with a very firm bed and crisp linens. I also had three additional cots in the room and could still move around easily. The bathroom needed some minor updating but was functional except for the shower head that I had to hold as it didn't fit properly in the holder. The staff was very helpful. The 5 euro breakfast is adaquet with fresh pastry, coffee, juice and granola.

Reviews.Title: “Reception not helpful”
Reviews.Author: traveller2501India
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel but because of last minute change in plan I had to cancel my booking, but the hotel reception guy was not helpful at all and did not even speak comprehensible english

Reviews.Title: “Bait-and-switch, anyone?”
Reviews.Author: stargirl0223
Reviews.Content: I was excited to be staying at the Villa Parco until about 2 minutes after my arrival. I booked my room for four people 1 week in advance. A few friends, who wanted to stay at the same hotel as us, booked 2 rooms a few days after us. When 2 of the 4 people arrived at the (beautiful looking) hotel to claim our room, we were informed that, despite our reservations, they had no room for us. Instead, they had a room at a "comparable" hotel which was closer to the dock. They explained it as if they were doing us a favour, by booking a hotel closer to the boat transport. So, after trekking via bus and by foot TO the hotel, we had to trek all the way back, to their "sister" hotel: Hotel Reiter. Unfortunately for us, Hotel Reiter was in no way, shape or form comparable to the type of facilities which we were paying for at Villa Parco. It was a 2-star hotel, and they expected the same payment as a 3-star. Not only that, but they tried to charge our 2 would-be roommates for our room that we had apparently "refused". Bottom line: they lied to both us and the rest of our party, they pulled a bait-and-switch, they demanded payment for subpar facilities at a different hotel, and they failed to contact us before hand about any changes to our reservation. Furthermore, our friends who were staying at the hotel who reserved rooms AFTER us ended up receiving a room. PS: There are also 6-in long crickets. Have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: dsfsdgdss
Reviews.Content: We had such a nice time here. The staff were so lovely and helped whenever they could. Well situated and right on the sea front. Great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Very cozy and quiet”
Reviews.Author: rcmessier73
Reviews.Content: I reserved this hotel through Venere, got a great deal of about $75eu per night. The staff was very kind, the room I stayed in was very roomy. (the first one left of the hotel counter.) The bathroom was obviously rennovated just recently, internet access was free when I stayed there. There is a bus stop about 5 mintues walking distance from the hotel. The hotel is about 7 minutes from the waterbus, and the waterbus is about 40 minutes to the main train station. It's far enough so the place remains quiet, close enough that you'd still be able to get to S. Mark within 20 minutes. Breakfast was included at the time of my stay. The usual Itailian freshly baked pastries and a variety of cereals and drinks were available. Overall, I really love this hotel. For the price that I paid, it was totally exceeding my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ciaogirl
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel to stay. It was clean, comfortable and the continental breakfast was fulfilling. The area is beautiful and the walk to the water bus station is peaceful and nice. A bit far from the sites, but I would stay in this hotel if no others closer to St. Mark's Square was not available.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Charming & Homely”
Reviews.Author: oldlerpoolian
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel twice. It is in a very quiet area, 10 minutes from the Vaporetto, which takes about 10 minutes more to St. Marks and about 40 minutes to P. Roma(the main bus station for Venice). We only paid â‚¬20 each for a double room. The breakfast was juice, rolls, croissants and coffee. If they ran out; the staff brought in more when asked. The entrance hall is large and has free internet access. The Lido busses are included in your vaporetti ticket. I was surprised to see that some reviewers thought the staff swere unhelpful; they were very pleasant to us on both of our visits. The terms were exactly as stated on their web site, with a reduction for cash.

Reviews.Title: “RUN away from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: LMDSTL
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awful!!! Compared to the other three star hotels I stayed in during our summer in Europe, this would maybe rank 1 and half. There is no elevator, it stinks, there are wires hanging out of the walls, and the staff is rude. It was our last stop in Europe and the third person traveling with us didn't come. We didn't know it until we checked in. Not only was the staff unaccommodating, but they were rude, and refused to let us speak to their manager. We were charged at a triple rate for a double room with a cot. We were told it was not possible to change the reservations because we booked online. They also did not refund part of our waterbus pass as their website promises because again, we booked online. This hotel is not worth the money. There are plenty of nice 2 or 3 star hotels on the mainland which would be much more worth your while. DO NOT STAY HERE!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money!”
Reviews.Author: PatLukes
Reviews.Content: My Mom and I stayed at the Villa Parco when visiting Venice because it was advertised as a renovated Villa. When we arrived, it was clear that this hotel had never seen a renovation. We had a big hole in our door, slept on a mattress that I would not even qualify as a mattress; it was more like a piece of foam on a piece of plywood. There was no lock on the door. We had a two day reservation that was required and left after the first night because we couldn't bear the thought of spending two nights there. After our first night's stay, we were to have a breakfast of rolls and coffee in the morning and went downstairs to find no rolls or coffee. We stood in the lobby amongst other very disgruntled travelers. The photos that you see of the hotel look very beautiful, when in fact the rooms have very old, run down furnishings. I'm surprised that these people are still in business.

Reviews.Title: “basic but clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Went to Venice July 2003 had a brilliant time the hotel is 5 min from boat service (inexpensive) took only 10 min to get to St Marks square would recomend get on and off at different stops instead of the norm all the time. Stayed in the hotel for a week Lido is small but has a beach which is woth a visit for a relaxing day. Free trip to Morrano compliments of the hotel. Took 40 min to get to the hotel by boat from airport no concerns everything went plain sailing to and from. Everybody was very friendly in Lido even managed to pick up a bit of Italian even if it was only solo formagio (only cheese, vegetarians). Basic rooms, small shower but worked well, maid service daily

Reviews.Title: “Off the beaten track”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have just found your web page, fascinating reviews! We stayed here two years ago in an effort to find cheap & quiet location. It was both ($50 per night). Future guests should bear in mind that the Lido is approx 40 mins by vaporetto to St Marks etc. so after a day's sightseeing we returned to our room for a wash & brush up and could hardly find the energy to troll back to the main island. It was Autumn and Aqua Alta had arrived! The Lido has a few charming resatuarants (one just on corner opposite hotel was obviously well requented by locals (always a good sign). We are returning to Venice this October and have opted to go upmarket (Metropole) mostly because we want to get up with the larks and explore on foot some of the more popular parts hopefully before they get too busy; something we missed out on staying on the Lido. I'm sure the Lido comes into it's own in the summer and I would recommend it to anyone really looking to do Venice as the many people who work there know it.

HotelInfo.Name: Villa Parco Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Rodi 1, 30126 Venice, Italy
